<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/apple-spotify-unveil-new-podcast-subscription-products?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Podcast Platforms Cash In
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/apple-spotify-unveil-new-podcast-subscription-products" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of a black slot machine with the words "Podcast Jackpot" emblazoned on it in red and gold. When the lever is pulled, reels displaying the Facebook, Spotify, and Apple logo rotate, landing on one of each company." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/woP6OeVP8kBgh3MUMy/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='A gif of a black slot machine with the words "Podcast Jackpot" emblazoned on it in red and gold. When the lever is pulled, reels displaying the Facebook, Spotify, and Apple logo rotate, landing on one of each company.' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/woP6OeVP8kBgh3MUMy/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The newsletter-for-your-ears industry is having its busiest month since the exposé of <em>Reply All</em>'s exposé:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last week, Apple </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/20/apple-announces-devices-custom-m1-chips-special-event?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a></span><span> its first foray into podcast subscriptions.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Then yesterday, Spotify </span><span><a href="https://hotpodnews.com/subscription-frenzy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">followed up</a></span><span> with details on its new subscription features.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These announcements show a ballooning industry navigating the choppy seas of monetization and greater competition. They could also mean changes in how Shankar Vedantam's dulcet tones make their way to your AirPods.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">About those subscriptions</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the same way that publishers have cloaked written digital content behind paywalls, many podcasts may soon become pay-to-play.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Apple's plan: </strong></span><span>For $19.99/year, podcasters can access features to turn their shows into subscription offerings. Apple takes a 30% cut of revenues the first year and 15% the following years.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Spotify's plan: </strong></span><span>a new ad marketplace that makes it easier for podcasters to find advertisers and the ability to distribute premium podcasts on other platforms. Spotify is also letting podcasters keep 100% of subscription revenues until 2023, when a 5% fee kicks in.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Apple has always been the top platform for podcasts (the name is literally a portmanteau of "iPod" + "broadcast"), but its lack of innovation until now let Spotify catch up quick. The Swedish streamer now has 2.2+ million podcasts and is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-spotify-and-the-new-battle-over-who-wins-podcasting-11619170206?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expected</a> to pass Apple in US pod listeners this year. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So will you pay? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While some podcasts have paid memberships, most are free and openly distributed. Now that leading platforms are doubling down on subscriptions, listeners may need to get more accustomed to paying for their favorite shows.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>NPR just </span><span><a href="https://hotpodnews.com/unpacking-nprs-subscription-plans/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revealed</a></span><span> paid subscriptions for ad-free podcasts, accessible through both Apple and Spotify. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Despite the drop-off in commuting, podcasts became <em>more</em> popular during Covid. An estimated 41% of the American population over the age of 12 listens in, and this year annual advertising revenues are expected to top $1 billion in the US for the first time.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/cdc-updates-maskwearing-guidelines?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Face Reveal We've All Been Waiting For
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/cdc-updates-maskwearing-guidelines" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Covid Mask Guidelines" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODgzL2NvdmlkX21hc2tfZ3VpZGVsaW5lcy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>CDC</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yours! Time to practice smiling with your teeth again, because the CDC updated its mask-wearing guidance yesterday from "mostly always" to "mostly just inside." The agency said that fully vaccinated folks can do the following activities <a href="https://www.axios.com/biden-cdc-coronavirus-guidance-masks-190a4299-05f1-4690-b4c5-d7c4e2c2f38f.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sans masks</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dine outside with non-roommates</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Go on walks, hikes, or bike rides alone or with household members</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Attend small, outdoor events, even if some attendees haven't been vaccinated yet</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why now? </strong>29% of Americans are fully vaccinated, and almost 43% have received 1+ dose. Plus, researchers' understanding of Covid-19 has come a long way since every Amazon package was treated like an Area 51 special delivery, and public health experts say it's rare for the virus to spread outdoors.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Vaccines need a marketing refresh</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pace of vaccinations has slowed down in the US, and the Biden administration <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-27/vaccinated-americans-can-go-unmasked-outdoors-cdc-says?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hopes</a> that FOMO from seeing vaccinated friends tandem-biking (as friends do) will spur the un-jabbed to act. In the words of President Biden, "For those who haven't gotten their vaccine yet...this is another great reason to go get vaccinated now."</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/companies-post-strong-quarters-pandemic-waning-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nice Quarter Ya Got There
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/companies-post-strong-quarters-pandemic-waning-us" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Google/Fitbit watch" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTY3L2dvb2dsZV9maXRiaXRfd2F0Y2gucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In Q1 2020, economies were shutting down, workers left half-eaten PB&Js in the office refrigerator, and business leaders prepared for mass layoffs.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fast forward one year: The sandwich is now a thriving weevil colony and some companies are posting their best quarterly performances...ever.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Alphabet: </strong>Google's parent <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-alphabet-googl-1q-earnings-report-2021-11619493812?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grew sales 34%</a> to a record $55.3 billion and more than doubled profits. Alphabet, which owns a thriving digital ad business, YouTube, and a cloud service, was in a perfect position to benefit from more screentime. Its stock is up more than 50% since the DOJ sued it over monopolistic behavior last October. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Microsoft: </strong>Microsoft also posted <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-27/microsoft-sales-rise-19-short-of-top-estimates-shares-slip?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strong results</a> that beat expectations, but shares dipped because it didn't beat them by <em>enough</em>. The tech company recorded its biggest quarterly jump in PC shipments in more than 20 years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Starbucks: </strong>US same-store sales <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/27/starbucks-sbux-q2-2021-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have returned</a> to pre-pandemic levels. While traffic is down by 10%, the average order has increased 21% (it's hard to resist that nitro cold brew). </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/key-performance-indicators-april-28?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Bud Light, the king of both watery beer and marketing, said it's giving away <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/bud-light-sports-ticket-100k/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100,000 free tickets</a> to sporting events in the "biggest sports ticket giveaway in the history of mankind." The campaign, which is valued at $10 million, is intended to boost attendance at stadiums that sat mostly empty over the last year. Your move, Natty Light. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">  <img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODgwL2NyYW1lcl90d2VldC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Heck ya we're fired up, Jim. By "the gauntlet," we can only assume Cramer means a wave of important tech earnings, Jerome Powell's press conference this afternoon, Biden's joint speech to Congress tonight, and the Baked Alaska we're about to flambé.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Who disrupts the disruptors? (<a href="https://www.notboring.co/p/who-disrupts-the-disrupters?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Not Boring</a>)</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/teen-banking-apps-secure-funding?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Why YOLO When Teens Can FICO?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/teen-banking-apps-secure-funding" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Lady Bird Teen Phone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=335 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xUOwG5vBijIVzXyoxy/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Lady Bird Teen Phone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xUOwG5vBijIVzXyoxy/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Teen allowance is being upgraded from cash wads to full-on banking apps. Yesterday, two such apps, Current and Step, announced <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/04/27/mobile-bank-current-raises-220-million-series-d-triples-valuation-to-2-2b/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new funding rounds</a> of $220 million and $100 million, respectively. Now worth $2.2 billion, Current tripled its valuation in just five months.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both apps let parents and teens make deposits and offer no-fee checking accounts, since in high school being a thousandaire feels like being London Tipton. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How are Current and Step different?</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Current focuses on signing up parents, while Step focuses on recruiting teens. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Current has almost 3 million users. Step has 1.5 million, but has only been around for six months.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Current's backed by traditional VC heavyweights like a16z. Step's investor lineup looks more </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/04/27/teen-banking-service-step-raises-100m-series-c-announces-steph-currys-investment/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">like a red carpet</a></span><span>: Charli D'Amelio, The Chainsmokers, and Will Smith, to name a few. And yesterday, it revealed Steph Curry was on board. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Current started as a debit card for teens, but it's expanded to digital banking more broadly.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>It's never too early to start building a credit score, apparently. Greenlight and Till Financial, digital banking apps that extend services to younger kids, also raised new funding rounds recently.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EXPLAINER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/reader-qa-getting-real-real-estate?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reader Q&A: Getting Real About Real Estate
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/27/reader-qa-getting-real-real-estate" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the wooden frame of a house in front of a lavender background. In front of the house is a red sign with four $ printed on it." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzQ0L2x1bWJlcl9wcmljZXMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every <span class="il">Wednesday</span>, we answer a <span class="il">reader</span>-submitted question about business and the economy. Want clarification on something you read in the Brew? </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23595897.0/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9KMEVIM3pmMz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B6eccdff6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://link.morningbrew.com/click/23595897.0/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9KMEVIM3pmMz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B6eccdff6&source=gmail&ust=1619651937989000&usg=AFQjCNEXZ8gnz7Hms6JQM0NoF0GmqRK4rw" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Click here and ask</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Q: </strong>"Will the housing market crash like it did in 2008?" —Jay in Salt Lake City</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A: </strong>We can all agree the housing market is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/22/realestate/us-home-sales-surge.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hotter</a> than a Phoenix parking lot in July right now. Prices are exploding in both suburban and urban markets. The search terms “should I buy a house” and “sell my house” are at record-highs. It’s feeling very 2006 out there, and not just because very few people are using Facebook.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But experts say that while it may <em>look</em> like a bubble and <em>feel</em> like a bubble...the market’s fundamentals aren’t that bubbly. Yes, prices are rising at an astonishing pace, but there are <a href="https://www.bankrate.com/mortgages/will-there-be-a-housing-market-crash/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">good reasons</a> for that: Housing inventory hit a record low this year, demand is so furious builders can’t keep up, and low mortgage rates are attracting new buyers into the marketplace.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, lenders these days are far more strict than before the previous crash, which has resulted in more creditworthy homeowners. The typical credit score for mortgage borrowers in the second half of last year was 786, a record high. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In conclusion, don’t expect a <em>Big Short 2</em>. But do expect an affordability crisis if we don’t build more homes.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/27/jpmorgan-tells-us-employees-they-are-expected-back-to-the-office-on-a-rotating-basis-by-july.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">JPMorgan</a></span><span> expects all US workers to be back in offices by early July on a "consistent rotational schedule."</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/550407-biden-to-seek-extra-80b-for-irs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">President Biden</a></span><span> reportedly wants to give the IRS an extra $80 billion to crack down on tax evasion by the wealthy and large corporations.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/minimum-wage-coronavirus-government-and-politics-politics-health-d89b279c821af20607a02fbcfd9d8ff4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Biden</a></span><span> also signed an executive order that increases the minimum wage for federal contractors to $15/hour. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/4/26/22404528/nasa-bezo-blue-origin-protest-spacex-contract?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Battle of the billionaires</a></span><span>: Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin is challenging NASA's decision to award SpaceX a $2.9 billion contract for a lunar lander.  </span>
</li>

GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let's get the bad taste of the 2021 Oscars out of our mouths with a movie trivia palate cleanser. We'll give you an excerpt from a memorable movie review, and you have to guess the movie. The year the movie was released is in parentheses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. "I've had mosquito bites that were more passionate than this undead, unrequited, and altogether unfun pseudo-romantic riff on 'Romeo and Juliet.'"—Marc Salov (2008)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. "This movie should have blown us out of the water. Instead, we catch ourselves occasionally thinking the unpardonable thought: 'OK, sink already.'"—Desson Howe (1997)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. "We aren't going to quibble about the genius business. Time will take care of that and if Welles goes down in history as one well be happy to have been among those who enjoyed the results of his great talent."—Ida Belle Hicks (1941)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. "The fact that a bouncy teenage sports comedy can even gesture toward serious matters of race and economic inequality is pretty impressive, as is the occasional snarl of genuine satire."—A.O. Scott (2000)</p>
</td>
</tr>

</th>
</tr>
</table>

When the lever is pulled, reels displaying the Facebook, Spotify, and Apple logo rotate, landing on one of each company.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=447 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/woP6OeVP8kBgh3MUMy/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt='A gif of a black slot machine with the words \"Podcast Jackpot\" emblazoned on it in red and gold. When the lever is pulled, reels displaying the Facebook, Spotify, and Apple logo rotate, landing on one of each company.' style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/woP6OeVP8kBgh3MUMy/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe newsletter-for-your-ears industry is having its busiest month since the exposé of \u003cem\u003eReply All\u003c/em\u003e's exposé:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast week, Apple \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/20/apple-announces-devices-custom-m1-chips-special-event?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its first foray into podcast subscriptions.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThen yesterday, Spotify \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://hotpodnews.com/subscription-frenzy/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efollowed up\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with details on its new subscription features.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese announcements show a ballooning industry navigating the choppy seas of monetization and greater competition. They could also mean changes in how Shankar Vedantam's dulcet tones make their way to your AirPods.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAbout those subscriptions\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the same way that publishers have cloaked written digital content behind paywalls, many podcasts may soon become pay-to-play.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApple's plan: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor $19.99/year, podcasters can access features to turn their shows into subscription offerings. Apple takes a 30% cut of revenues the first year and 15% the following years.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpotify's plan: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ea new ad marketplace that makes it easier for podcasters to find advertisers and the ability to distribute premium podcasts on other platforms. Spotify is also letting podcasters keep 100% of subscription revenues until 2023, when a 5% fee kicks in.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eApple has always been the top platform for podcasts (the name is literally a portmanteau of \"iPod\" + \"broadcast\"), but its lack of innovation until now let Spotify catch up quick. The Swedish streamer now has 2.2+ million podcasts and is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-spotify-and-the-new-battle-over-who-wins-podcasting-11619170206?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpected\u003c/a\u003e to pass Apple in US pod listeners this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo will you pay? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile some podcasts have paid memberships, most are free and openly distributed. Now that leading platforms are doubling down on subscriptions, listeners may need to get more accustomed to paying for their favorite shows.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNPR just \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://hotpodnews.com/unpacking-nprs-subscription-plans/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevealed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e paid subscriptions for ad-free podcasts, accessible through both Apple and Spotify. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite the drop-off in commuting, podcasts became \u003cem\u003emore\u003c/em\u003e popular during Covid. An estimated 41% of the American population over the age of 12 listens in, and this year annual advertising revenues are expected to top $1 billion in the US for the first time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYours! Time to practice smiling with your teeth again, because the CDC updated its mask-wearing guidance yesterday from \"mostly always\" to \"mostly just inside.\" The agency said that fully vaccinated folks can do the following activities \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/biden-cdc-coronavirus-guidance-masks-190a4299-05f1-4690-b4c5-d7c4e2c2f38f.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esans masks\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDine outside with non-roommates\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGo on walks, hikes, or bike rides alone or with household members\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAttend small, outdoor events, even if some attendees haven't been vaccinated yet\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy now? \u003c/strong\u003e29% of Americans are fully vaccinated, and almost 43% have received 1+ dose. Plus, researchers' understanding of Covid-19 has come a long way since every Amazon package was treated like an Area 51 special delivery, and public health experts say it's rare for the virus to spread outdoors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eVaccines need a marketing refresh\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pace of vaccinations has slowed down in the US, and the Biden administration \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-27/vaccinated-americans-can-go-unmasked-outdoors-cdc-says?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehopes\u003c/a\u003e that FOMO from seeing vaccinated friends tandem-biking (as friends do) will spur the un-jabbed to act. In the words of President Biden, \"For those who haven't gotten their vaccine yet...this is another great reason to go get vaccinated now.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn Q1 2020, economies were shutting down, workers left half-eaten PB\u0026Js in the office refrigerator, and business leaders prepared for mass layoffs.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFast forward one year: The sandwich is now a thriving weevil colony and some companies are posting their best quarterly performances...ever.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAlphabet: \u003c/strong\u003eGoogle's parent \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-alphabet-googl-1q-earnings-report-2021-11619493812?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrew sales 34%\u003c/a\u003e to a record $55.3 billion and more than doubled profits. Alphabet, which owns a thriving digital ad business, YouTube, and a cloud service, was in a perfect position to benefit from more screentime. Its stock is up more than 50% since the DOJ sued it over monopolistic behavior last October. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMicrosoft: \u003c/strong\u003eMicrosoft also posted \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-27/microsoft-sales-rise-19-short-of-top-estimates-shares-slip?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrong results\u003c/a\u003e that beat expectations, but shares dipped because it didn't beat them by \u003cem\u003eenough\u003c/em\u003e. The tech company recorded its biggest quarterly jump in PC shipments in more than 20 years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStarbucks: \u003c/strong\u003eUS same-store sales \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/27/starbucks-sbux-q2-2021-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave returned\u003c/a\u003e to pre-pandemic levels. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTeen allowance is being upgraded from cash wads to full-on banking apps. Yesterday, two such apps, Current and Step, announced \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/04/27/mobile-bank-current-raises-220-million-series-d-triples-valuation-to-2-2b/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew funding rounds\u003c/a\u003e of $220 million and $100 million, respectively. Now worth $2.2 billion, Current tripled its valuation in just five months.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoth apps let parents and teens make deposits and offer no-fee checking accounts, since in high school being a thousandaire feels like being London Tipton. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow are Current and Step different?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCurrent focuses on signing up parents, while Step focuses on recruiting teens. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCurrent has almost 3 million users. Step has 1.5 million, but has only been around for six months.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCurrent's backed by traditional VC heavyweights like a16z. Step's investor lineup looks more \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/04/27/teen-banking-service-step-raises-100m-series-c-announces-steph-currys-investment/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elike a red carpet\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: Charli D'Amelio, The Chainsmokers, and Will Smith, to name a few. And yesterday, it revealed Steph Curry was on board. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCurrent started as a debit card for teens, but it's expanded to digital banking more broadly.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIt's never too early to start building a credit score, apparently. Prices are exploding in both suburban and urban markets. The search terms “should I buy a house” and “sell my house” are at record-highs. It’s feeling very 2006 out there, and not just because very few people are using Facebook.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut experts say that while it may \u003cem\u003elook\u003c/em\u003e like a bubble and \u003cem\u003efeel\u003c/em\u003e like a bubble...the market’s fundamentals aren’t that bubbly. Yes, prices are rising at an astonishing pace, but there are \u003ca href=\"https://www.bankrate.com/mortgages/will-there-be-a-housing-market-crash/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egood reasons\u003c/a\u003e for that: Housing inventory hit a record low this year, demand is so furious builders can’t keep up, and low mortgage rates are attracting new buyers into the marketplace.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, lenders these days are far more strict than before the previous crash, which has resulted in more creditworthy homeowners. The typical credit score for mortgage borrowers in the second half of last year was 786, a record high. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn conclusion, don’t expect a \u003cem\u003eBig Short 2\u003c/em\u003e.
